title: Is civil engineering a good career choice? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes.Civil engineering is oldest branch of engineering. Entire civilization (सभ्यता ) is related to this branch and thus it has got the name CIVIL Engineering. But one always forgets that it is “civil engineering” rather than BUILDING ENGINEERING. So I would mention some works where civil engineers are required. In building and construction of houses, industries, commercial structures etc which is commonly known to all.In all the geological and geotechnical investigation and site selection for all the mega projects of DAMS, channels and other hydraulic projects.There are N numbers of surveys and planning of cities , townships there you need themExecution of construction of roads,railways, airport runways etc.Bridges, tunnels ,decks etc are some places where you are 0 without civil engineers.STP WTP (Water treatment plant and sewage treatment plant ) believe me here , right from designing of tanks to future regulation of supply and maintenance all is done by civil engineer and NOT CHEMICAL ENGINEER.VALUATION , for urging loans you need valuation of you asset and than only banks give it to you. So valuation is purely done by civil engineer.Every year there are vacancy for government jobs in various fields and maximum vacancy is always available for civil engineers.You can score good marks in Gate and get direct job for PSU , with huge packageBut , the important thing is you cant achieve anything being lazy and simply waiting. Get out of the room do personal survey, and know what exactly is needed to market and where your interest is… Have healthy discussions with teachers, seniors and parents and finally take decision on your own.. 😄

A civil engineering degree prepares you for work in the construction industry as well as in the business, management and financial sectors. As a qualified civil engineer you can find work in a range of sectors, particularly in the construction sector, on buildings and large structures of all kinds, transport and communications infrastructure. Well, there are a few good universities in India for Civil Engineering.Lovely Professional University is One of India’s Best Civil Engineering college in Punjab, School of Civil Engineering empowers its students with state-of-the-art technologies and latest labs that are at par with international education standards. The students contain a superb blend of skill, leadership and, innovation leading to awe-inspiring placements. Emphasizing the need to evolve and create the smart cities of tomorrow, LPU School of Civil Engineering focuses on creating professionals that become the inventors of future sustainable technology. Most of the faculty staff are from reputed organizations with their highest degree from various reputed institutes such as IITs, NITs, etc. Apart from that, faculty have got previous industrial experience also. The capstone project is an integral part of B. Tech program in which students have to pick a live project based on the practical problem-based scenario (ideally from industry) and work for six months under a mentor and present a report at the end. This is beneficial to enhance your presentation skills. There is an internship program which could be an opportunity for getting work experience and increase your chance to get employment after you pass out. But, of course, your academic record should be good to get this placement option. Industrial visits are organized to nearby construction sites from time to time. You have to ask questions yourself and trigger interest in the activities around you. You will get some courses from soft skills, English language, mental and analytical aptitude side. This sounds dull to you as of now. But you will feel its importance when you face an interview panel in a company during your placement drives.
